fields.headline: England's countdown to Euro 2012
fields.bodyText: 13 May The final day of the Premier League season and, with Harry Redknapp having insisted he will not leave Tottenham in the lurch, the moment he could finally swap club for country 26 May England face Norway at the Ullevaal Stadion in Oslo in their first warm-up match ahead of the European Championship. This could well be Redknapp's first game in charge 29 May England's 23-man squad for the finals in Poland and Ukraine is announced. Much intrigue will surround whether or not John Terry and Rio Ferdinand are both selected in the final party 2 June Belgium arrive at Wembley for England's final warm-up match. The opposition, who have not qualified for Euro 2012, are likely to contain the Manchester City captain, Vincent Kompany 3 June England depart for the European Championship, or, more specifically, the Hotel Stary in Krakow, where Fabio Capello decided to base the squad for the tournament before his resignation 11 June Laurent Blanc's France are the opposition in Donetsk, Ukraine, for England's opening match of Euro 2012. Wayne Rooney serves the first of his two‑match suspension
